Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Particularly \Par*tic"u*lar*ly\, adv. 1. In a particular manner; expressly; with a specific reference or interest; in particular; distinctly. [1913 Webster]
2. In an especial manner; especially; in a high degree; as, a particularly fortunate man; a particularly bad failure. [1913 Webster]
The exact propriety of Virgil I particularly regarded as a great part of his character. --Dryden. [1913 Webster]

particularly adv 1: to a distinctly greater extent or degree than is common; "he was particularly fussy about spelling"; "a particularly gruesome attack"; "under peculiarly tragic circumstances"; "an especially (or specially) cautious approach to the danger" [syn: {peculiarly}, {especially}, {specially}] 2: specifically or especially distinguished from others; "loves Bach, particularly his partitas"; "recommended one book in particular"; "trace major population movements for the Pueblo groups in particular" [syn: {in particular}] 3: uniquely or characteristically; "these peculiarly cinematic elements"; "a peculiarly French phenomenon"; "everyone has a moment in history which belongs particularly to him"- John Knowles [syn: {peculiarly}]
